title: Southern Cornbread
tagline: Cast iron, crispy edges, no sugar. The way it should be.
description: Cast iron, crispy edges, no sugar. The real Southern way. Serves 8.
ingredients: 1½ cups cornmeal (stone-ground if you can find it)
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F. Place 10-inch cast iron skillet in oven while it heats.
Whisk cornmeal, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in large bowl.
Melt 6 tablespoons butter. Whisk with buttermilk and egg in another bowl.
Pour wet ingredients into dry. Stir until just combined. Don't overmix.
Carefully remove hot skillet from oven. Add remaining 4 tablespoons butter, swirl to coat.
Immediately pour batter into sizzling butter. It should sizzle loudly.
Bake 20-25 minutes until golden brown and toothpick comes out clean.
Brush top with more butter if desired. Let cool 5 minutes before slicing.
notes: HOT skillet + butter = crispy crust: This is non-negotiable. The sizzle when batter hits the pan creates the crust.
No sugar: Southern cornbread is savory. If you want sweet, that's Northern-style (and that's fine, just different).
Cast iron matters: Retains heat, creates crispy edges. A regular pan won't give the same results.
Bacon grease: For extra flavor, replace some butter with bacon drippings.
Serve with: Chili, beans, collard greens, or crumbled into buttermilk (yes, really).
